text:
Irving Thomas Stuttaford, OBE (4 May 1931 – 8 June 2018) was a British physician, author, and medical columnist of "The Times". He served as a Conservative Member of Parliament from 1970 to 1974.
In 2002, he retired as Senior Medical Advisor for Barclays Bank. In the years that followed he continued to write a regular monthly column for "The Oldie" and was a frequent contributor to "Healthspan", an online retailer of vitamin supplements, and occasionally to other national newspapers and journals.
Stuttaford died on 8 June 2018 at the age of 87.
